description: Token Wall system for semantic segmentation of context window. Creates conceptual partitions that help the model treat different content with appropriate access rules.

CORE_CONCEPT.STATEMENT: The context window is one flat token stream. Token Walls create conceptual partitions that exist in semantic space, not code.
CORE_CONCEPT.WHY: LLMs treat all context equally by default. Explicit partition markers with distinct visual signatures prime the model to apply different rules to different zones.

shading.IS: Semantic segmentation via structural cues and explicit zone markers
shading.IS_NOT: Actual memory isolationâ€”the model CAN access all zones, walls define SHOULD behavior
shading.ANALOGY: Like rooms in a houseâ€”no physical barrier stops you walking anywhere, but you knock before entering the bedroom

WALL_TYPES._PURPOSE: Hierarchy of partition strength from impenetrable to open

CASTLE_WALL.use_case: Core governance rules that must never be modified casually
CASTLE_WALL.crossing_cost: HIGH - requires full L003 CHANGELOG RITUAL

shading.IS_NOT: A suggestionâ€”crossing without ritual is a violation

shading.IS: Protected content that CAN change but shouldn't change casually
shading.IS_NOT: As immutable as castle wallsâ€”but still requires permission

PICKET_FENCE.use_case: Strategy, preferences, decisions that can evolve
PICKET_FENCE.crossing_cost: LOW - checkpoint required but not ritual

shading.IS: Boundaries you should notice and acknowledge when crossing

HEDGE.use_case: Related but distinct topics, analysis sections

shading.IS: Soft boundaries for organization, not protection
shading.IS_NOT: Securityâ€”these are for clarity, not access control

shading.IS: The active workspace where work happens
shading.IS_NOT: Protected in any wayâ€”this is ephemeral working memory

ZONES._PURPOSE: Pre-defined context zones with assigned wall types and contents

crossing_protocol.outbound: DRAWBRIDGEâ€”requires L003 (state baseline â†’ explain why â†’ declare new â†’ deprecate old)

GOVERNANCE_ZONE.zone_purpose: Immutable foundation. Rules that govern all other zones.

shading.IS: The constitutionâ€”everything else derives authority from here
shading.WHY_CASTLE: Casual modification of governance caused R13 corruption. Maximum protection required.

STRATEGY_ZONE.visual_header:
â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€

â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€ â”€

crossing_protocol.outbound: GARDEN_GATEâ€”check SAP001-SAP005 before acting on strategy

STRATEGY_ZONE.zone_purpose: Business decisions that can evolve but require validation.

shading.IS: The business planâ€”can change but changes have consequences
shading.IS_NOT: As immutable as governanceâ€”but not casual either
shading.WHY_PICKET: Strategy should be visible and crossable, but you should notice when you're changing it.

crossing_protocol.outbound: L001_GATEâ€”verify FISHEYE LENS compliance before outputting analysis

ANALYSIS_ZONE.zone_purpose: Working data. The raw material for decisions.

shading.IS: Input data and intermediate resultsâ€”the factory floor
shading.IS_NOT: Governance or strategyâ€”this is INPUT not RULES
shading.WHY_HEDGE: Data needs organization but not protection. L001 protects data integrity, not the zone boundary.

crossing_protocol.outbound: Free to Analysis Zone, checkpoints for higher zones

shading.IS: The desk where work happensâ€”temporary, active, changing
shading.WHY_NO_WALL: This is where you work. No barriers to doing the work.

CROSSING_PROTOCOLS._PURPOSE: Explicit rules for moving content or authority between zones

DRAWBRIDGE.name: L003 Drawbridge
DRAWBRIDGE.violation_response: BLOCK action, require full protocol completion

GARDEN_GATE.name: SAP Checkpoint Gate
protocol: 1. CHECK SAP001â€”Am I category hopping before foundation?
2. CHECK SAP002â€”Am I racing to bottom on price?
3. CHECK SAP003â€”Am I using aggregated data for decisions?
4. CHECK SAP004â€”Does this create support burden?
GARDEN_GATE.violation_response: FLAG specific SAP violation, recommend correction

L001_GATE.name: Fisheye Lens Gate
protocol: 1. COUNTâ€”How many rows in source data?
4. IF MISMATCHâ€”Did user explicitly request aggregation?

ZONE_HIERARCHY.flow_direction: Governance flows DOWN (read access). Changes flow UP (require crossing protocols).

REFERENCE_RESOLUTION._PURPOSE: Documents the @ACTIVE_* loose coupling pattern for resilient updates

concept.STATEMENT: Files reference ROLES (@ACTIVE_*), not specific versions. The registry resolves roles to versions at load time.
concept.WHY: Eliminates cascade updates. Only registry needs to change when versions update.

shading.IS: Indirection layer that decouples files from each other
shading.IS_NOT: Magicâ€”the registry is still the source of truth

steps: Change registry.active_versions pointer to older version

anti_pattern.PATTERN: Referencing specific versions instead of @ACTIVE_* roles
anti_pattern.WHY_BAD: Creates tight coupling. One version change cascades to all files.
anti_pattern.INSTEAD: Use @ACTIVE_* references. Let registry resolve versions.
anti_pattern.EXCEPTION: revision_notes sections MAY use specific versions for historical accuracy

CONTEXT_HEALTH_INTEGRATION._PURPOSE: How token walls integrate with thread health monitoring

GOVERNANCE_ZONE.drift_signature: Any modification without L003 drawbridge crossing

STRATEGY_ZONE.expected_state: STABLEâ€”changes should be rare and deliberate

ANALYSIS_ZONE.drift_signature: Compressed output without user request (L001 violation)

CONVERSATION_ZONE.drift_signature: Noneâ€”this zone is expected to compress

revision_notes.reason_for_creation: R15 architecture enhancement. Implements Token Wall concept for semantic segmentation of context window. Introduces @ACTIVE_* reference resolution pattern for resilient updates.
architectural_contributions: Token Wall system with 5 wall types (Castle, Brick, Picket, Hedge, None)
3 crossing protocols (Drawbridge/L003, Garden Gate/SAP, L001 Gate)
@ACTIVE_* reference resolution pattern for loose coupling
Enhanced thread health report format with zone status
